response:
Immediate imaging is required to visualise the optic nerve and spinal cord for inflammation/demyelination. Extensive bloods are necessary to investigate the very high CRP (ruling out infection vs vasculitis) and test for specific demyelinating antibodies. Temporal artery assessment is crucial to rule out GCA.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Cervical Spine with contrast", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)", "C-reactive protein", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "Serum AQP4 antibodies", "Serum MOG antibodies", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ANCA, dsDNA)", "Syphilis serology", "Lyme disease serology", "Blood cultures", "Lumbar Puncture for CSF analysis (microscopy, culture, oligoclonal bands)", "Temporal Artery Ultrasound or Biopsy"]
